IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: SERVICES TO DISABLED, ELDERLY, AND DISADVANTAGED
IRS990.MissionDescription: SERVICES TO DISABLED, ELDERLY, AND DISADVANTAGED
IRS990.Description: TRAINING AND PROVIDEING JOBS TO DIABLED AND DISADVANTAGED THROUGH GOODILL OPERATIONS. VOCATIONAL EVALUATION ANE TRAINING SERVICES FOR DIABLED AND DISADVANTAGED. 3,178 INDIVIDUALS ASSISTED.

Activity2.Description: DIRECT SERVICES - HOME HEALTH CARE,MEDICAL SERVICES AND HOUSING FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED. 10,572 INDIVIDUALS SERVED UNDER VARIOUS PROGRAMS.

Activity3.Description: PUBLIC HEALTH EDUCATION - INFORMATION, REFERRAL, ATTITUDE AWARENESS AND SUPPORT GROUPS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. 7,054 INDIVIUALS WERE SERVED UNDER THE PROGRAM.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FUNDS ARE TO BE USE TO FUND FUTURE PROGRAM EXPANSION

THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAX PURPOSES UNDER SECTION 501(C) (3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. NO PROVISION HAS BEEN MADE FOR INCOME TAXES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS ADOPTED FASB ASC 740-10-25 "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY FOR INCOME TAXES", IN 2010. THE MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT AUGUST 31, 2010. THERE IS NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAXES IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE 2007, 2008 AND 2009 TAX YEARS ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL TAX AUTHORITIES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 8

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XIII, LINE 2D

SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 7
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: MANAGEMENT EMPLOYEES HAVE AN INCENTIVE PROGRAM SHOULD THEY MEET SPECIFIC OPERATIONAL GOALS. THE INCENTIVE IS ALSO CONDITIONAL UPON THE MEETING CERTAIN OVERALL ORGANIZATIONAL FINANCIAL GOALS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: EXPLANATION ON VOLUNTEERS AND TYPES OF SERVICES OR BENEFITS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION USES UNPAID VOLUNTEERS IN SOME OF ITS PROGRAMS, FUND-RAISING AND COMMITTEE ASSIGNMENTS.
AFFILIATE EASTER SEALS HOUSING SOLUTION, INC. HAS POLICIES CONSISTENT WITH THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COPY OF FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE FILING
CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY MANAGEMENT FOR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS.

THE COMPENSATION OF THE TOP OFFICAL IS DETERMINED BY A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD , PAST CHAIRMAN AND ONE OTHER BOARD MEMBER. THEY USE COMPARSION SALARY DATA FROM NATIONAL EASTER SEALS, GOODWILL INDUSTRIES AND OTHER LOCAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THESE FACTORS AND THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CEO ARE CONSIDERED IN DETERMINING THE LEVEL OF SALARY PAID.

THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER DETERMINES THE SALARIES OF OTHER TOP OFFICALS BASED ON COMPARSIONS WITH NATIONAL EASTER SEALS, GOODWILL INSUTRIES, AND LOCAL NON-ORGANIZATIONS AND THEIR INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE. THE SALARIES ARE INCLUDED IN THE BUDGET FOR THE ORGANIZATION, WHICH IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
PARENT ORGANIZATION HAS FILED A SEPARATE RETURN
